citeinfo.origin: United States Department of Commerce, United States Census Bureau (Data creator)
citeinfo.title: CENSUS_MCD_POPCHANGE_IN: Population Densities and Changes of Densities of Minor Civil Divisions in Indiana from 1890 to 2000 (United States Census Bureau, 1:500,000, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: CENSUS_MCD_POPCHANGE_IN was derived by modification of a shapefile named "CENSUS_HISTORICAL_MCD_IN."

descript.abstract: Historical census data for minor civil divisions (also known as "civil townships") in Indiana were provided by personnel of the Indiana Business Research Center to personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS). The data were joined by personnel of IGS to a shapefile of minor civil divisions. The historical census data consisted of population statistics from 1890 to 2000. The boundaries of civil townships are not believed to have changed greatly during the past 110 years. Using these data, personnel of the IGS calculated population density for each civil township during census years and changes of density for each decadal period.
descript.purpose: CENSUS_MCD_POPCHANGE_IN.SHP was created to provide a GIS data layer of historical population changes for Indiana, by minor civil divisions (civil townships).

idinfo.native: Windows 2000 operating system; ESRI ArcGIS 8.3 shapefile; approximately 933 Kb

attracc.attraccr: No formal metadata in the format of the Federal Geographic Data Committee (FGDC) was provided by the Indiana Business Research Center pertaining to population statistics for civil townships in Indiana from 1890 to 2000.

dataqual.logic: No checks for logical consistency were made.
dataqual.complete: No information is available regarding the completeness of this data.

horizpa.horizpar: No information was provided by the U.S. Census Bureau pertaining to the horizontal positional accuracy of the source data.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this data.

citeinfo.title: 2000 County Subdivisions

pubinfo.publish: Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division, Cartographic Operations Branch

citeinfo.othercit: This source file can be downloaded at the following URL: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/cob/cs2000.html

srcinfo.typesrc: Zip file containing an ESRI interchange file (E00)
srcinfo.srccontr: Minor Civil Divisions (MCDs) for Indiana in 2000

procstep.procdesc:
CS18_D00_E00.ZIP was downloaded from the USCB and unzipped. ESRI ArcToolBox was then used to convert the ESRI interchange file CS18_D00.E00 to an ESRI coverage named "MCD_IN." MCD_IN was then converted to a shapefile named MCD_IN.SHP. ESRI ArcToolBox "Define Projection Wizard" was then used on MCD_IN.SHP to define the projection provided, which was Geographic (Lat/Long) NAD83. ESRI ArcToolBox "Project Wizard" was then used to reproject to UTM Zone 16, NAD83, and the output shapefile was named CENSUS_HISTORICAL_MCD_IN.SHP. ESRI ArcMap was then used to edit the shapefile, and the following fields were dropped from the attribute table: "Area," "Perimeter," "MCD_IN_," "MCD_IN_I," "State," "LSAD," and "LSAD_TRANS."
Two additional edits were made to the attribute table using ESRI ArcMap. Names of Indiana counties were added to a field named "Cnty_Name," using the "Join" function, and the field named "Name" was re-named as "MCD_Name."

A Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named "TOWNSHIP_COUNTS_1890TO2000.XLS" was provided by personnel of the Indiana Business Research Center (IBRC) to personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS). Using ESRI ArcView v. 3.2, the data in this spreadsheet was joined by IGS personnel to a shapefile named "MINOR_CIVIL_DIVISIONS_IN.SHP," using the field named "MCDFIPS" in TOWNSHIP_COUNTS_1890TO2000 and the field named "COUSUBFP" in MINOR_CIVIL_DIVISIONS_IN.
Fields containing population data from 1890 through 2000 were re-named "POP1890" through "POP2000," respectively.
Using ESRI ArcView v. 3.2, the shapefile named "MINOR_CIVIL_DIVISIONS_IN.SHP" was edited by adding a field named "CalcArea." Values for this field were calculated using the calculator function and the following formula: CalcArea = [Shape].ReturnArea. Values in that field had units of "square meters."
Using ESRI ArcView v. 3.2, the shapefile named "MINOR_CIVIL_DIVISIONS_IN.SHP" was edited by adding a field named "Area_KM2." Values for this field were calculated using the calculator function by dividing CalcArea by 1,000,000. Values in the field have units of "square kilometers."
The field named "CalcArea" was removed.
Using ESRI ArcView v. 3.2, the shapefile named "MINOR_CIVIL_DIVISIONS_IN.SHP" was edited by adding fields named "POPDENS1890" through "POPDENS2000." Values for these fields were calculated using the calculator function and dividing "POP1890" through "POP2000," respectively, by "Area_KM2." Values in these field have units of "persons per square kilometer."
A copy of the shapefile named "MINOR_CIVIL_DIVISIONS_IN.SHP" was renamed "CENSUS_HISTORICAL_MCD_IN."
The shapefile named "CENSUS_HISTORICAL_MCD_IN" was opened in ESRI ArcView version 3.2 and fields were added named "D20_90," "D90_80," "D80_70," and so forth. These were populated by using the calculator function to subtract population densities for 1990 from population densities for 2000 ("D20_90"), population densities for 1980 from population densities from 1990 ("D90_80"), and so forth. Values in this field have units of "persons per square kilometer." Negative values indicate a loss of population for a minor civil division (Civil Township), while positive values indicate a gain of population.
A copy of the shapefile named "CENSUS_HISTORICAL_MCD_IN" was renamed "CENSUS_MCD_POPCHANGE_IN."

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

The following source citation should be included: CENSUS_MCD_POPCHANGE_IN: Population Densities and Changes of Densities of Minor Civil Divisions in Indiana from 1890 to 2000 (United States Census Bureau, 1:500,000, Polygon Shapefile), digital representation by Denver Harper, 2004.
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405 2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.

The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
